basic.floral_language:
Sempervivum arachnoideum ssp. tomentosum
Floriography: wonderful, characteristic, tough
Has a peculiar plant form with multiple layers of fleshy leave arranged like a ball, with many silk-like tissues around the leaf tips, like cobwebs, in a cool season with abundant sunlight, the plant is more compact and lower leaf surface turns purple red. 
Likes sunshine, has a short dormant period under summer high temperature, place under scattered light. Flowers sometimes, pink color, but usually the plant dies after flowering.
basic.color: Leaf color green, when sunny lower surface turning to fuchsia

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, dormant in summer under high temperatures, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
